Bachelor of Software Engineering | Bachelor of Software Engineering

* Title: Mobile Applications Development	Code: CNTT1157
* Credits: 3 (45)
* Credit hours for teaching and learning activities:
+ Lecture: 25 hrs.
+ Exercises in class: 10 hrs.
+ Presentation and Discussion: 10 hrs.
+ Self-study: 60 hrs.
* Parallel course(s):
* Prerequisite course(s): CNTT1131, CNTT1116
* Department conducting the course:
+ Faculty: Information Technology; Room 1310, Building A1, National Economics University; Phone number: 024.36280.280 (6334)
+ Lecturers:
1. PhD. Phạm Xuân Lâm	Tel: 0937638683	Email: lampx@neu.edu.vn
2. MSc. Phạm Thảo	Tel: 0966986689	Email: thaop@neu.edu.vn
* The course:

Foundation | Foundation | Fundamental (x) | Fundamental (x)
Compulsory | Elective | Compulsory | Elective (x)
* Course language: 	In English
* Meeting hour: 8AM – 11AM on Wednesdays, Room 13.10, Building A1, National Economics University

The course aims to provide students with basic knowledge of application programming on mobile devices with Android or iOS. Students will be instructed to use Java and Objective C, Swift ... or cross-platform tools such as Xamarin, Reactive Native, Flutter ... Students will be equipped with knowledge depending on each different platform to program, develop, and distribute mobile applications.
Course content includes:
- Overview of mobile programming
- Development tools
- Components of a mobile application
- Mobile User Interface (UI)
- Store data online/offline.
- Multitasking and asynchronous processing
- Build applications based on device features.
- Learn and use APIs.
- Application testing and distribution
The course also aims to train thinking skills, the ability to self-study knowledge, and technology to develop mobile applications by working independently as well as in groups. Students will be divided into groups to learn deeply about technologies, from which they can present in their solutions using modern technologies to develop mobile applications.
Applications will be developed during the learning process through lessons and group exercises:
- Calculator: Application that can perform basic math operations.

- Notes: Application for taking notes and managing tasks.
- Clock: Create a simple clock application.
- Unit Converter: Application that supports measurement and unit conversion.
- Weather: Displays weather forecast information
- Health: Record user steps
- Quiz: Display the quiz and check the player's answer.
- Expensify: Track personal income and expenditure.
- Book: Book management and reading application.
- Music Player: A simple music player.
- Cooking: Displays cooking recipes.
- Vocab: The application supports learning vocabulary

* Textbooks/Lecture Notes:
- Le Hoang Son (2018) Android programming, Nhà xuất bản xây dựng
- Unlocking Android, W. Frank Ableson, Charlie Collins, Robinsen
* Additional references:
- Professional Android Application Development, Reto Meier
- Swift Programming: The Big Nerd Ranch Guide
- iOS Programming: The Big Nerd Ranch Guide
- Creating Mobile Apps with Xamarin. Forms Book First Edition
- Learning React Native: Building Native Mobile Apps with JavaScript

Table 4. Course goals
Goals | Goals Description | Proficiency scale
G1 | The course provides fundamental knowledge about mobile application development, enabling students to understand programming principles and apply it to develop software for mobile devices. Students can analyze, design, program, test, and distribute mobile applications through application stores. | 3-4
G2 | The course helps students develop communication, presentation, report writing, and time management skills. It provides practical training in professional skills necessary for mobile application development. | 3U
G3 | The course contributes to developing the ability to work independently and collaboratively, fostering a correct understanding of responsibilities in task execution and professional ethics. | 3

Table 5. Course learning outcomes (CLOs)
Goals | CLOs | CLOs Description | Teaching level (I,T,U)
G1 | CLO1.1 | Understanding how mobile app works on mobile devices, classifying and practicing several types of mobile applications, and exploring methods for mobile application development. | I
G1 | CLO1.2 | Applying fundamental programming techniques for mobile application development. | T
G1 | CLO1.3 | Applying testing techniques, assessing quality, and performance to apps, distribute app to app stores | U
G2 | CLO2.1 | Having the skills to search, gather, synthesize, analyze, and present information to solve problems related to mobile apps developing. | U
G2 | CLO2.2 | Having the ability to coordinate and collaborate to solve group assignments, ensuring the team completes tasks according to schedule. | U
G2 | CLO2.3 | Having the skills to use tools to optimize code and reduce programming time. | U
G3 | CLO3.1 | Having the ability to self-study and research relevant to complete assigned tasks. | U
G3 | CLO3.2 | Having a sense of organization and discipline in the classroom, adhering to class rules, demonstrating a cooperative spirit, and taking personal responsibility for assigned activities. | U
G3 | CLO3.3 | Understanding the responsibilities in task execution, maintaining professional ethics in tasks related to mobile developing. | U

Midterm assessment | Midterm assessment | Midterm assessment | Midterm assessment

Group project (20%): Group production. Group presentation | CLO1.x CLO2.x CLO3.x | 40% | 14
Summative assessment | Summative assessment | Summative assessment | Summative assessment
Final exam | CLO1.x CLO2.x CLO3.x | 50% | As scheduled

8.3. Requirements for in-class behavior
